text: Outputting longitude latitude data (columns arranged order) terminal label column provides required data formats mean linked data can analyzed using Geographical Model BayesTraits. using BayesTraits.inputs, make sure spreadsheet georeferenced data associated traits also includes terminal column accession/sample linked corresponding tip label input phylogenetic tree.

what: Create sample of trait data using a subset of explanatory variables
title: 1. Creating input data for independent contrast regression analysis
text: example generates linked mean data files “DBH” defined response variable listed first “bio12” “bio15” explanatory variables listed second third. Thus, first name reported argument traitcols define response variable.
code: library(InNOutBT) library(treeio)  traitdata <- read.csv("Data/vataireoids_1610_25May2022_BayesTraits.csv") phylo <- read.beast("Data/vatcomb30_24May22_Yule.con.tree")  BayesTraits.inputs(tree = phylo,                    data = traitdata,                    tipscol = "terminal",                    traitcols = c("DBH", "bio12", "bio15"),                    dir_create = "results_BayesTraits_input",                    fileDistData = "BayesTraits_linked_data_bio12_bio15.txt",                    fileMeanData = "BayesTraits_mean_data_bio12_bio15.txt")

what: Log transform any variable before creating the input mean and linked data
title: 1. Creating input data for independent contrast regression analysis
text: may want log-10 transform variable running phylogenetic regression analysis. argument logtransf, just report variables/traits log-transformed. log-transformed trait always result new column new name additional prefix “log10” added, following: “log10NAMEOFTHETRAIT”. name(s) log-transformed trait(s) used analyses listed argument addtraits. Note example , variable “DBH” chosen log-transformed also response variable. case, need reorder variables argument ordtraits make sure newly generated “log10DBH” variable reported first thus serve response variable. may also want save copy original spreadsheet includes new column log-transformed DBH reporting name data file copy argument fileOrigData.
code: BayesTraits.inputs(tree = phylo,                    data = traitdata,                    tipscol = "terminal",                    logtransf = "DBH",                    traitcols = c("bio12", "bio15"),                    addtraits = "log10DBH",                    ordtraits = c("log10DBH", "bio12", "bio15"),                    dir_create = "results_BayesTraits_input",                    fileDistData = "BayesTraits_linked_data_bio12_bio15.txt",                    fileMeanData = "BayesTraits_mean_data_bio12_bio15.txt",                    fileOrigData = "vataireoids_1610_25May2022_BayesTraits_DBH_logtransf.csv")

what: Create sample of trait data using a different subset of explanatory variables
title: 1. Creating input data for independent contrast regression analysis
text: setting argument NodeCount = TRUE, function calculate net node count species/accession given phylogenetic tree reference. Net nodes node count used explore effects speciation rates (e.g. O’Donovan et al. 2018) response variable. example chose log10-transform response variable “DBH” newly created column net nodes, listed arguments addtraits ordtraits.
code: BayesTraits.inputs(tree = phylo,                    data = traitdata,                    tipscol = "terminal",                    NodeCount = TRUE,                    logtransf = c("DBH", "NodeCount"),                    traitcols = c("bio12", "bio15"),                    addtraits = c("log10NodeCount", "log10DBH"),                    ordtraits = c("log10DBH", "bio12", "bio15", "log10NodeCount"),                    dir_create = "results_BayesTraits_input",                    fileDistData = "BayesTraits_linked_data_bio12_bio15_nnodes.txt",                    fileMeanData = "BayesTraits_mean_data_bio12_bio15_nnodes.txt",                    fileOrigData = "vataireoids_1610_25May2022_BayesTraits_netnodes_logtransf.csv")

what: Create sample of trait data using quadratic net nodes as the explanatory variable
title: 1. Creating input data for independent contrast regression analysis
text: may want square transform variable running phylogenetic regressions. just need provide argument sqrtransf variables/traits squared. square-transformed trait always result new column new name additional prefix “sqr” added following: “sqrNAMEOFTHETRAIT”. name(s) square-transformed trait(s) used analyses listed argument addtraits. Note example newly created variable “NodeCount” chosen log10-transformed log10-transformed squared.
code: BayesTraits.inputs(tree = phylo,                    data = traitdata,                    tips_colname = "terminal",                    NodeCount = TRUE,                    logtransf = c("DBH", "NodeCount"),                    sqrtransf = c("NodeCount"),                    addtraits = c("sqrNodeCount", "log10DBH"),                    ordtraits = c("log10DBH", "log10NodeCount", "sqrNodeCount"),                    dir_create = "results_BayesTraits_input",                    fileDistData = "BayesTraits_linked_data_nnodes_nnodes2.txt",                    fileMeanData = "BayesTraits_mean_data_nnodes_nnodes2.txt",                    fileOrigData = "vataireoids_1610_25May2022_BayesTraits_netnodes_logtransf_sqrtransf.csv")

what: Processing Log and Stone output files
title: 3. Processing output data from independent contrast regression analysis
text: function BayesTraits.outputs reads processes Log Stones .txt output files resulting independent contrast regression analyses generates tables Word CSV formats, summarizes competing model ranks log likelihood scores. Heatmaps derived pairwise Bayes Factors generated PDF format can used identify competing modes similar model highest log likelihood score. Heatmap including Bayes Factor pairwise comparison: Heatmap clustering models based Bayes Factor values: Table describing models coefficients: See also associated article create input files BayesTraits.inputs independent contrast regression analyses, well another article create shell script BayesTraits.shell analysis one multiple models.
code: library(InNOutBT)  BayesTraits.outputs(logst_dir = paste0(getwd(),"/BayesTraits_outputs_log_stone"),                     responvar = "DBH",                     explanvar = c("bio12", "bio15", "nnodes"),                     treetransf = c("Kappa", "Delta", "Lambda", "OU", "UNI", "VR", "Fabric"),                     bayesfactor = TRUE,                     unirates = FALSE,                     outformat = c("Word", "CSV"),                     tableleg = "Phylogenetic regression in BayesTraits: models and coefficients.",                     dir_create = "results_BayesTraits_output",                     outfile = "BayesTraits_output_table",                     height = 12,                     width = 15)

title: 2. Shell scripts for independent contrast regression analysis

code: #install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("DBOSlab/InNOutBT") library(InNOutBT)

title: 2. Shell scripts for independent contrast regression analysis
text: Set argument syst = "unix" create shell script running phylogenetic regressions macOS Monterey. Note give name response variable analysis argument responvar. Also, use argument treetransf define (listed vector) available tree transformation models want run phylogenetic regressions input data. , choose among models Kappa, Delta, Lambda, OU (Ornstein–Uhlenbeck), UNI (set complete default BayesTraits regression analysis, .e. assumed uniform rates evolution tree transformation models estimated), VR (used variable rates) Fabric (want use general statistical mode accommodates uneven evolutionary landscape described Pagel et al., 2022).
code: library(InNOutBT)  BayesTraits.shell(meanfile_dir = "results_BayesTraits_input/09Jun2022",                   linkfile_dir = "results_BayesTraits_input/09Jun2022",                   treefile_dir = "Data",                   BayesTraits_dir = "/Users/domingoscardoso/BayesTraitsV4",                   responvar = "DBH",                   treetransf = c("UNI", "Lambda", "VR", "Fabric"),                   Kappa = NULL,                   Delta = NULL,                   Lambda = NULL,                   OU = NULL,                   VRLambda = FALSE,                   bi = "30000000",                   it = "130000000",                   sa = "100000",                   st = c("500", "50000"),                   syst = "unix",                   dir_create = "results_BayesTraits_shell",                   cc_DataTree = TRUE)

title: 2. Shell scripts for independent contrast regression analysis
text: Set argument syst = "windows" create PowerShell script running phylogenetic regressions Windows.  function generates running BayesTraits commands multiple regressions, depending parameters set arguments treetransf, bi, , sa, st. Note set argument cc_DataTree = TRUE, tree, mean data, linked data files also copied directly BayesTraits folder. Note set arguments Kappa, Delta, Lambda, OU default NULL, tree transformation models estimated, provided also listed argument treetransf. can also set vector specific value 0 1. example, want run analyses specific estimated values Lambda, set vector c(“0.001”, “1.0”, “Estimate”). Also, define logical argument VRLambda TRUE, specific values set tree transformation models parameters Kappa, Delta, Lambda OU considered separate runs using model variable rates VR, provided also chosen model parameter treetransf.
code: BayesTraits.shell(meanfile_dir = "results_BayesTraits_input/09Jun2022",                   linkfile_dir = "results_BayesTraits_input/09Jun2022",                   treefile_dir = "Data",                   BayesTraits_dir = "/Users/domingoscardoso/BayesTraitsV4",                   responvar = "DBH",                   treetransf = c("UNI", "Lambda", "VR", "Fabric"),                   Kappa = NULL,                   Delta = NULL,                   Lambda = NULL,                   OU = NULL,                   VRLambda = FALSE,                   bi = "30000000",                   it = "130000000",                   sa = "100000",                   st = c("500", "50000"),                   syst = "windows",                   dir_create = "results_BayesTraits_shell",                   cc_DataTree = TRUE)

title: 2. Shell scripts for independent contrast regression analysis
text: using function BayesTraits.shell needed parameters, set permission shell script run automatically phylogenetic regression analyses BayesTraits program. can just follow steps . 1. Open terminal; 2. Go BayesTraits program folder saved shell script file .sh associated running input data files function BayesTraits.shell. shell script named run_BayesTraits_shell_unix.sh; 3. Execute following line:chmod 777 run_BayesTraits_shell_unix.sh 4. perform BayesTraits run using shell script executing following line:./run_BayesTraits_shell_unix.sh

title: 2. Shell scripts for independent contrast regression analysis
text: using function BayesTraits.shell needed parameters, set permission PowerShell script run automatically phylogenetic regression analyses BayesTraits program. can just follow steps , may also want find information use Windows PowerShell. 1. Open PowerShell Administrator; 2. Go BayesTraits program folder saved PowerShell script file .ps1 associated running input data files function BayesTraits.shell. PowerShell script named run_BayesTraits_shell_windows.ps1; 3. Execute following line choose option [Y]Yes;Set-ExecutionPolicy -ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned -Scope LocalMachine 4. Execute following line:Unblock-File -Path .\run_BayesTraits_shell_windows.ps1 5. perform BayesTraits run using PowerShell script executing following line:.\run_BayesTraits_shell_windows.ps1 See also associated article automatically create input files BayesTraits.inputs phylogenetic regression analyses, well another article use BayesTraits.outputs process resulting output files analyses.

what: 1. phyreg.inputs: Creating input mean and linked data for phylogenetic regression analyses
title: An R package for creating input data to and processing output data from BayesTraits analyses
text: function produces required BayesTraits input data linked samples trait/climate data (distribution data), generating two text files, one includes mean values associated trait associated terminal taxon second reports samples trait values linked sampled one accession associated terminal taxon. function also includes argument calculate net node count species/accession given phylogenetic tree. Net node counts used explore effects speciation rates response variable (e.g. O’Donovan et al. 2018).

previous_headings: Usage > 1. phyreg.inputs: Creating input mean and linked data for phylogenetic regression analyses
title: An R package for creating input data to and processing output data from BayesTraits analyses
code: library(InNOutBT) library(treeio)  traitdata <- read.csv("Data/vataireoids_1610_25May2022_BayesTraits.csv") phylo <- read.beast("Data/vatcomb30_24May22_Yule.con.tree")  phyreg.inputs(tree = phylo,               data = traitdata,               tipscol = "terminal",               NodeCount = TRUE,               logtransf = c("DBH", "NodeCount"),               traitcols = c("bio12", "bio15"),               addtraits = c("log10NodeCount", "log10DBH"),               ordtraits = c("log10DBH", "bio12", "bio15", "log10NodeCount"),               dir_create = "results_BayesTraits_phyreg_input",               fileDistData = "BayesTraits_linked_data_bio12_bio15_nnodes.txt",               fileMeanData = "BayesTraits_mean_data_bio12_bio15_nnodes.txt",               fileOrigData = "vataireoids_1610_25May2022_BayesTraits_netnodes_logtransf.csv")

what: 2. phyreg.shell: Creating shell script for running phylogenetic regression analyses
title: An R package for creating input data to and processing output data from BayesTraits analyses
text: Using directory paths tree input files mean linked trait data, function produces shell scripts Unix Windows PowerShell formats running one multiple phylogenetic regression analyses. function creates necessary batch file commands, including desired settings burnin, iterations, stepping stones parameters (e.g., abbreviated bi, , sa, st) given run, addition incorporating model tree transformation. example , use “UNI”, “Lambda”, “VR” treefransf argument indicate want three separate sets batch file commands identical except one, designated “UNI” estimate “Lambda” “VR” (variable rates). use “UNI” indicate assumption uniform rates evolution tree transformation (e.g., estimating “Lambda”). case, “UNI” consider default BayesTraits regression analysis “Lambda” assumes default setting 1.0 (see BayesTraits manual).

title: Process BayesTraits output data — BayesTraits.outputs
text: logst_dir Path directory stored log stepping stones files generated independent contrast regression analysis. log file(s) contain model options output. stepping stones file(s) contain marginal log likelihood given model. files labeled explanatory variable(s) relevant model, variable separated underscore. Explanatory variables include tree transformation included model, can include Kappa, Delta, Lambda, OU (Ornstein–Uhlenbeck), UNI (tree transformation), VR (variable rates) Fabric (model accommodates uneven evolutionary landscape, described Pagel et al. (2022). Thus, Log file(s) format like "BayesTraits_mean_data_bio12_bio15_VR.log.txt" "BayesTraits_mean_data_bio12_bio15_nnodes_Lambda.log.txt" (nnodes signifies net nodes). indicates first log file contains three explanatory variables ("bio12", "bio15", variable rates), second log file contains four explanatory variables ("bio12", "bio15", "nnodes", Lambda). Stepping stones file(s) named correspondingly (e.g., "BayesTraits_mean_data_bio12_bio15_VR.stones.txt" "BayesTraits_mean_data_bio12_bio15_nnodes_Lambda.stones.txt".) responvar Report name response variable. explanvar Report name(s) explanatory variable(s) exactly also written names log stones files processed. treetransf Select available BayesTraits tree transformations (Kappa, Delta, Lambda, OU, UNI, VR Fabric) included among competing models. bayesfactor Logical, FALSE, Bayes Factor pairwise comparisons performed among models. unirates Logical, FALSE, models lacking tree transformations (Kappa, Delta, Lambda OU) variable rates Fabric (.e., default values uniform rates evolution assumed) displayed main table. outformat Define either "Word" "CSV", , vector c("Word", "CSV"), writing results formats. tableleg legend main table, provided also chosen outformat = "Word". report legend, Word-formatted table default legend Phylogenetic regression BayesTraits: models coefficients. dir_create Path directory file(s) saved. default setting creates directory named results_BayesTraits_output results saved subfolder named current date. outfile Name resulting table-formatted files either "Word", "CSV", (depending specified argument outformat). name reported, default setting creates file named BayesTraits_output_table.docx /BayesTraits_output_table.csv. ... Additional parameters passed pdf.

text: meanfile_dir Path folder directory data file(s) containing trait means samples trait data () stored. linkfile_dir Path folder directory data file(s) containing samples linked trait data () stored. treefile_dir Path folder directory tree file stored. BayesTraits_dir Path folder directory BayesTraits executable file stored. responvar Report name response variable analysis. treetransf vector format, report tree transformation models estimated, Kappa, Delta, Lambda, OU (Ornstein–Uhlenbeck). model variable rates VR Fabric model can reported , latter statistical model accommodating uneven evolutionary landscape, described Pagel et al. (2022). use UNI designation uniform rates evolution VR estimated tree transformation models estimated (e.g., Lambda assumed 1.0). case, "UNI" set complete default BayesTraits regression analysis. Kappa set default NULL, tree transformation model estimated, provided also defined previous parameter treetransf. can also set vector specific value 0 1. want run analyses specific estimated values Kappa, set vector c("0.001", "1.0", "Estimate"). Report number character (.e., quotes). Delta set default NULL, tree transformation model estimated, provided also defined previous parameter treetransf. can also set vector specific value 0 1. want run analyses specific estimated values Delta, set vector c("0.001", "1.0", "Estimate"). Report number character (.e., quotes). Lambda set default NULL, tree transformation model estimated, provided also defined previous parameter treetransf. can also set vector specific value 0 1. want run analyses specific estimated values Lambda, set vector c("0.001", "1.0", "Estimate"). Report number character (.e., quotes). OU set default NULL, tree transformation model estimated, provided also defined previous parameter treetransf. can also set vector specific value 0 1. want run analyses specific estimated values OU, set vector c("0.001", "1.0", "Estimate"). Report number character (.e., quotes). VRLambda Logical, default FALSE. set TRUE, specific values set tree transformation models Kappa, Delta, Lambda OU considered separate runs using model variable rates VR, provided also chosen model parameter treetransf. bi Set number iterations MCMC burnin. Report number character (.e., quotes). Set number total iterations MCMC chain. Report number character (.e., quotes). sa Set sample frequency. Report number character (.e., quotes). st stepping stone sampler estimate marginal likelihood. Report number stones use number iterations stone characters (.e., vector numbers quotes). syst Report operating system ("unix" "windows"). dir_create Path computer's working directory file(s) saved. default setting creates directory "results_BayesTraits_output" results saved within subfolder named current date. cc_DataTree Logical, default TRUE. copy tree file mean linked data files made BayesTraits folder BayesTraits executable file located.
